etymologies: early 17th century (in the sense ‘a star’): via Latin from Greek astēr ‘star’

definitions: a plant of the daisy family that has bright rayed flowers, typically of purple or pink.

notes.text: Genus Aster, family Compositae: numerous species, many of which bloom in autumn, including the wild purple New England aster (A. novae-angliae). See also China aster

shortDefinitions: plant of large genus that includes Michaelmas daisy

definitions: a radiating array of microtubules associated with a centrosome in a dividing cell.
shortDefinitions: radiating array of microtubules associated with centrosome in dividing cell
